verbose_text: Initially, we found that the DarG macrodomain is sufficient to both de-ADP-ribosylate ssDNA in vitro (XREF_FIG A) and abrogate DarT G49D toxicity in vivo (XREF_FIG B), while K54A substitution of the DarG macrodomain abolishes DNA ADP-ribosyl glycohydrolase activity (XREF_FIG A) and is incapable of restoring bacterial viability in the presence of DarT G49D (XREF_FIG B).
evidence: DarG macrodomain abolishes DNA ADP-ribosyl glycohydrolase
